question.title: Proguard does not obfuscate gui components

node.contents: How did you determine that your GUI classes were not obfuscated?

astNode.text: How did you determine that your GUI classes were not obfuscated?

node.contents: I think it is a known issue with `actionbarsherlock`

astNode.text: I think it is a known issue with `actionbarsherlock`

node.contents: I did determine that my GUI classes were not obfuscated, because after obfusecating my app, I used the dex2jar disassembler to get a jar file of my apk. Then I used a java decompiler with a gui. There I can see that all my classes were obfuscated, except my GUI classes

astNode.text: I did determine that my GUI classes were not obfuscated, because after obfusecating my app, I used the dex2jar disassembler to get a jar file of my apk. Then I used a java decompiler with a gui. There I can see that all my classes were obfuscated, except my GUI classes

node.contents: I would like to use ProGuard to obfuscate my Android app. This works fine. But my gui classes, which extends acitvity, view and sherlockactivity are not obfuscated. Here is the proguard.cfg

astNode.text: I would like to use ProGuard to obfuscate my Android app. This works fine. But my gui classes, which extends acitvity, view and sherlockactivity are not obfuscated. Here is the proguard.cfg

node.contents: First, I thought activities can´t be obfuscated because of the reflection call

astNode.text: First, I thought activities can´t be obfuscated because of the reflection call

node.contents: But it does not solve the problem. Any ideas how to obfuscate the gui elements?

astNode.text: But it does not solve the problem. Any ideas how to obfuscate the gui elements?

node.contents: @ChristineBauers The most important part of this answer is telling you to _not_ even try to obfuscate your Activity. You could change the rules to get it done, but then Android would not be able to find your lifecycle methods, which would at best leave your activity unusable, and at worst might cause application-crashing exceptions.

astNode.text: @ChristineBauers The most important part of this answer is telling you to _not_ even try to obfuscate your Activity. You could change the rules to get it done, but then Android would not be able to find your lifecycle methods, which would at best leave your activity unusable, and at worst might cause application-crashing exceptions.

node.contents: Ooohh .. know I got it. Thanks a lot :)

astNode.text: Ooohh .. know I got it. Thanks a lot :)

node.contents: But my gui classes, which extends acitvit, view and sherlockactivtiy are not obfusecated.

astNode.text: But my gui classes, which extends acitvit, view and sherlockactivtiy are not obfusecated.

node.contents: That is because your ProGuard configuration file says to not obfuscate them. Moreover, this is important, as if they are obfuscated, your app will not run, because:

astNode.text: That is because your ProGuard configuration file says to not obfuscate them. Moreover, this is important, as if they are obfuscated, your app will not run, because:

node.contents:
• Android will not find your renamed activities
  • Android will not find your activity lifecycle methods
  • Android will not find your widgets (for use with reflection in interpreting layout resources)
  • etc.

astNode.text:
• Android will not find your renamed activities
  • Android will not find your activity lifecycle methods
  • Android will not find your widgets (for use with reflection in interpreting layout resources)
  • etc.

node.contents: I´ve tried to added: -keep public class mypackege.myactivity.class But it does not solve the problem.

astNode.text: I´ve tried to added: -keep public class mypackege.myactivity.class But it does not solve the problem.

node.contents: That is because you are telling ProGuard to not obfuscate that class.

astNode.text: That is because you are telling ProGuard to not obfuscate that class.

node.contents: Any ideas how to obfusecate the gui elements?

astNode.text: Any ideas how to obfusecate the gui elements?

node.contents: You don't, if you wish to have a working app when you are done.

astNode.text: You don't, if you wish to have a working app when you are done.
